result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald W Eberhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit 355 days.
Concurrent with: Other probations

miscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURT, ANY BOND APPLIES

Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs.    Defendant shall not enter a bar, tavern, or establishment where primary purpose is the sale or consumption of alcohol.  Defendant cannot vote; Defendant cannot possess firearms.

Defendant shall successfully complete drug court;  Defendant shall write an apology letter to victim and letter shall be reviewed by PO before sending.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample; Defendant shall comply with any programs or assessments required by PO.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed.  May serve in Chippewa if at no cost to Dunn.     ***AMEND TO REFLECT THAT THIS IS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME TO BE HELD IN ABEYANCE.  MAY BE USED BY PO IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE **

DE request to run jail sentence concurrent.  State is opposed to request.

Defendant, Donald W Eberhardt, in custody, appeared with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Maki .  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  11:28 am.  PO Jill Flier appears telephonically.  

All parties have reviewed PSI.  No corrections or additions.  No agreement as to sentence.
State argues. 4 yrs - 2 yrs IC and 2 yrs Ext. Superv.
 Atty. Kelm argues against prison sentence. 
6 yrs prison - 3 IC, 3 EX - Imposed and stayed. 
Defendant makes statement to court.  

COURT:  w/held sentence
6 yrs probation - concurrent with other probations
6 mo. jail - consecutive to other jail sentences.  Huber allowed.
May serve in Chippewa at no cost to Dunn
Cond:  successfully complete drug court
pay restitution - see order.  All to victim.
Write apology letter to victim - to be reviewed by PO before sending
$268 cc and $250 DNA, $10 Drug chg.
Provide DNA sample (already done)
Comply with any programs of assessments required by PO
No alcohol or illegal drugs.  Cannot enter establishment where primary source of income is alcohol sales.
Credit for 355 days.
Cannot vote or posses firearms.
